info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 5:14AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS AND SLIPPERY CONDITIONS POSSIBLE IN THE NORTH CAROLINA COUNTIES ALONG THE TENNESSEE BORDER THIS MORNING... Scattered snow showers will continue to develop across the higher terrain along the Tennessee and North Carolina border this morning. Locations above 3000 feet close to the Tennessee and North Carolina border could see accumulations up to an inch by the middle part of the morning. Locally higher amounts could occur, with 2 to 4 inches possible at higher ridge tops at and above 5000 feet, by the time the snow showers taper off late this afternoon. Temperatures falling below the freezing mark early this morning may create slippery road conditions at times. If you are traveling in the Tennessee border counties of the North Carolina mountains during this period, use extra caution and watch out for black ice or snow covered roadways.
